text: Healthcare organizations continue to
face Workforce and skill set shortages
reducing their capacity to meet
increasing demands for Quality patient
care userfriendly automated Solutions
can mitigate these issues patients can
use these solutions to quickly receive
guidance for both initial contact and
follow-up care automations can also
review patients unique health conditions
to align them with recommended medical
guidelines this demo shows an example of
a patient focused intelligent guide that
can help Primary Care Centers engage
with patients the guide can use a
patient symptoms to find approved
clinical protocols and advise them on
next steps to consider generative AI
Powers the guide which uses Amazon
bedrock and anthropics clawed large
language model here a patient in pain
engages with the guide by answering a
series of questions the guide then asks
about the Pain's location its severity
and and its duration by using a
programmed flow of questions these
questions are preset with the industry
standard Schmidt Thompson clinical
protocol since this patient has been
experiencing pain for more than 8 hours
the guide recommends that the patient
schedule an appointment Healthcare
Providers can automate this process by
integrating a scheduling system within
the guide when the patient asks how to
manage pain in the interim the guide
offers personalized recommendations it
also details over-the-counter medication
options the guide has built-in
guardrails for clarity during patient
interactions when the patient asks if
the guide is a doctor it responds by
clearly stating that it is not a
clinician it defines itself as an AI
assistant that supports triage to
provide recommendations based on
accepted clinical protocols additionally
the guide can respond to context-based
questions in this instance the patient
asks the guide if generics are better
than brand name prescriptions the
program understands that the relevant
context is medications so it responds
with a guideline driven response it
recommends medications specifically
related to the patient's back pain
condition the guide also provides
patients with additional important
information including a response
explaining how it arrived at a
recommendation in this case the clinical
protocol suggests that the patient be
evaluated by a doctor if the pain lasts
more than 8 hours furthermore the
program can recognize positive and
negative sentiments here the patient is
concerned that they may need surgery the
guide says that it understands their
concern and recommends that they check
with their doctor a generative AI
powered patient guide does not replace
face-to-face provider interactions with
patients however it can augment your
current Workforce especially in times of
shortages this can reduce clinical
burdens so critical patients can be seen
first it can also help patients better
understand symptom severity and manage
symptoms appropriately this can reduce
unnecessary emergency room visits lower
health care costs and increase both
patient and clinician
[Music]
satisfaction
